title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{f{\left(x_1\right)}-f{\left(x_2\right)}}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$x+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and $$x$$ for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression ((2(x+h)**2-3(x+h))-(2x**2 -3x))/(x+h - x).
speech: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is  fraction, f of, parentheses x sub 1  minus, f of, parentheses x sub 2 , over, x sub 1 minus x sub 2,  . So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in  x plus, h  for  x sub 1  and  x  for  x sub 2 , and we get the expression ((2(x+h)**2-3(x+h))-(2x**2 -3x))/(x+h - x).

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the numerator, and we get the expression $$4xh+2h^2-3h$$.
speech: Simplify the numerator, and we get the expression  4 x h, plus 2 h squared, minus 3 h .
pacedSpeech: Simplify the numerator, and we get the expression   4 x h, plus 2 h squared, minus 3 h

title: Divide
text: $$\frac{Divide}{Cross}$$ out the $$h$$ terms in the numerator and denominator, and we get our answer $$4x+2h-3$$.
speech: Divide over Cross  out the  h  terms in the numerator and denominator, and we get our answer  4 x plus 2 h minus 3 .
